precontext: The siblings spent their summer exploring the beach. They often searched for interesting things that washed ashore. One day, they stumbled upon something curious hidden in the sand.
sentence: They discovered an old log near the shore that revealed a lot about the past.
meanings_considered: a segment of the trunk of a tree when stripped of branches
a written record of events on a voyage (of a ship or plane)
explanation:
• The precontext mentions the siblings searching for items washed ashore, making a tree trunk (wood) a plausible and contextually relevant object found in the sand.  
• A ship or plane log is unlikely in this context, as there is no mention of maritime activity or vessels, and "log" as a record would not naturally be "found in the sand."  
• The phrase "revealed a lot about the past" fits well with a historical record (like a ship log), but the physical discovery of an object in the sand strongly suggests a literal, physical item rather than a written record.
clear_meaning_text: a segment of the trunk of a tree when stripped of branches
